official-title.#text:
To direct the President to take action to protect against the transmission of Ebola virus from
			 individuals traveling to the United States from abroad, and for other
			 purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Protecting against the transmission of Ebola from individuals traveling from abroad

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text:
prohibit any individual from entering the United States for a period of 30 days following the
			 individual’s presence in a country experiencing an Ebola outbreak;

before allowing any individual who is a national of a country experiencing an Ebola outbreak, or
			 has recently been present in such a country, to enter the United States,
			 ensure that—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Centers for Disease Control and
			 Prevention

text.#text:
the individual tests negative for the Ebola virus by means of a serum neutralization, a polymerase
			 chain reaction (PCR), an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA), or
			 another diagnostic test approved by the
the individual’s body temperature is measured as being normal; and

one or more qualified health care professionals provides written certification of the negative test
			 results under subparagraph (A) and the normal body temperature measurement
			 under subparagraph (B); and

as a condition on allowing an individual described in paragraph (2) to enter the United States,
			 require such individual to submit to a 21-day period of monitoring for
			 symptoms of Ebola virus disease.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may exempt officials, employees, and contractors of the
from the requirements of subsection (a) if the

determines that such Departments have sufficient measures in place to
			 protect against the transmission of Ebola virus by such individuals.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Centers for Disease Control and
			 Prevention

term.#tail:
means a country whose population is experiencing Ebola virus disease in epidemic proportions, as
			 determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
as capable of providing the written certification under
			 subsection (a)(2)(C).
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Centers for Disease Control and
			 Prevention

term.#tail: means recognized by the American Medical Association or the

quote.#tail:
means, with respect to human body temperature, within 1 degree Fahrenheit of 98.6 degrees
			 Fahrenheit.
